text: Out of Africa is a 1985 American epic romantic drama movie directed and produced by Sydney Pollack. It stars Meryl Streep and Robert Redford. The movie is based on the 1937 autobiographical book Out of Africa written by Isak Dinesen, about her life in Kenya. The movie also stars Michael Kitchen as Berkeley Cole, Malick Bowens as Farah, Stephen Kinyanjui as the Chief, Michael Gough as Lord Delamere, Suzanna Hamilton as Felicity, and the model and actress Iman as Mariammo. The movie had mixed reviews from critics. However, Out of Africa won seven Academy Awards including Best Picture and Best Director for Pollack. ==References== Category:1985 romantic drama movies Category:1980s epic movies Category:Academy Award winning movies Category:American romantic drama movies Category:American epic movies Category:British romantic drama movies Category:Movies based on books Category:Movies set in Denmark Category:Movies set in Kenya Category:Movies set in country houses Category:Movies set in the 1910s Category:Movies set in the 1920s Category:Movies set in the 1930s Category:Movies directed by Sydney Pollack Category:Movies composed by John Barry Category:Universal Pictures movies Category:Movies based on autobiographies Category:1980s English- language movies
title: Out of Africa (movie)
